comments.label: [[Typical Settlement Cracks]] Monitor
comments.text: Typical settlement cracks were observed in the foundation. These conditions are common in homes of this age and type. Monitor over time for changes.

comments.label: [[Major Settlement]] Possible Repair
comments.text: Evidence of significant foundation settlement was observed at (location). The rate of movement cannot be determined during a one-time visit. Repairs may be needed to help prevent further movement. Recommend evaluation by a qualified foundation repair contractor.

comments.label: [[Large Foundation Cracks]] Monitor / Repair
comments.text: Larger-than-typical foundation cracks were observed at (location). These may indicate structural movement. Monitor for changes, and consider evaluation by a qualified contractor if worsening occurs.

comments.label: [[Foundation Wall Leaning]] Monitor / Possible Repair
comments.text: A foundation wall was noted to be leaning or bowed at (location). The rate of movement cannot be determined during a one-time inspection. Recommend evaluation by a qualified foundation contractor.

comments.label: [[Foundation Water Staining]] Monitor
comments.text: Water staining was observed on the foundation wall at (location). The area was dry at time of inspection. Monitor during wet weather for signs of active leakage.

comments.label: [[Efflorescence]] Monitor
comments.text: Efflorescence, a white mineral deposit, was observed on the foundation wall. This typically indicates past moisture entry. Monitor for recurrence or active water infiltration.

comments.label: [[Typical Floor Structure Conditions]] Note
comments.text: Typical wear and aging were observed in the floor structure. No significant concerns were noted unless otherwise described.

comments.label: [[Floor Sagging]] Monitor / Repair
comments.text: Sagging of the floor structure was observed at (location). This is common in older homes but should be monitored for changes. Repairs may be needed if movement progresses.

comments.label: [[Broken Beam in Crawlspace]] Repair
comments.text: A broken structural beam was observed in the crawlspace. The beam showed no support between steel reinforcement beams. Evaluation and repair by a qualified structural contractor is recommended.

comments.label: [[Joists Improperly Sistered]] Repair
comments.text: Floor joists were found to be sistered using short lengths that do not provide adequate support. This condition has allowed movement to occur. Recommend evaluation and repair by a qualified contractor.

comments.label: [[Support Post Not Plumb]] Monitor
comments.text: A structural support post was observed to not be plumb. Settlement has likely occurred in this area. Movement appears to have been halted by reinforcement, but the area should be monitored for changes.

comments.label: [[Typical Settlement Cracks in Walls]] Note
comments.text: Minor settlement cracks were observed in the walls. These conditions are typical and generally not of structural concern.

comments.label: [[Large Wall Cracks]] Monitor / Possible Repair
comments.text: Cracking larger than typical was observed in wall structures. These areas should be monitored for worsening and evaluated if movement continues.

comments.label: [[Foundation Reinforced with I-Beams]] Note
comments.text: The foundation walls had been reinforced with steel I-beams at some point. These are typically installed to help stabilize movement. Monitor over time for any changes.

comments.label: [[Typical Roof Structure Conditions]] Note
comments.text: The visible portions of the roof structure showed typical conditions for a home of this age. No significant deficiencies were noted unless otherwise reported.

comments.label: [[Roof Ridge Sagging]] Monitor / Possible Repair
comments.text: Sagging or deflection of the roof ridge was observed. Monitor for changes; evaluation by a qualified roofing or structural contractor may be desirable.

comments.label: [[Roof Truss Modified]] Repair
comments.text: A roof truss has been modified or cut. Truss alterations can negatively affect the structural integrity of the roof. Evaluation and repair by a qualified structural contractor are recommended.

comments.label: [[No Visible WDI Activity]] Note
comments.text: No visible signs of wood-destroying insect activity were observed during the inspection. As with all homes, periodic monitoring is recommended.

comments.label: [[Evidence of Previous WDI Activity]] Monitor
comments.text: Evidence of previous wood-destroying insect activity was observed. No active infestation was apparent. Monitoring and periodic evaluation may be desirable.

comments.label: [[WDI Damage Observed]] Repair
comments.text: Damage consistent with wood-destroying insects was observed at (location). Recommend evaluation and treatment by a qualified pest control specialist.

comments.label: [[Crawlspace Access Limited]] Limitation
comments.text: Inspection of the crawlspace was limited due to restricted access, low clearance, or obstructions.

comments.label: [[Crawlspace Moisture]] Monitor / Repair
comments.text: Moisture was observed in the crawlspace at (location). This area should be monitored, and drainage or vapor barrier improvements may be needed.

comments.label: [[Crawlspace Wood Damage]] Repair
comments.text: Damage to wood structural components in the crawlspace was observed at (location). Repairs by a qualified contractor are recommended.

comments.label: [[Typical Minor Leakage Signs]] Monitor
comments.text: Minor signs of leakage were observed in the basement/crawlspace. These conditions are common. Monitor during heavy rain for active leakage.

comments.label: [[Active Leakage]] Repair
comments.text: Active leakage was observed at (location). Recommend evaluation and correction by a qualified waterproofing contractor.

comments.label: [[Monitor Structural Changes]] Note
comments.text: Structural components should be periodically monitored for any changes, especially cracks, movement, or moisture intrusion.

comments.label: [[Routine Maintenance Recommended]] Note
comments.text: Routine exterior maintenance, drainage control, and prompt repair of minor defects can help prolong the life of the structure.
